captions.text:
Remember all those magical places in your
favorite childhood stories? And did you wish
you could visit them?
Well, guess what...your wish came true!

Hey, I'm Mel, here in Fantasyland, which has
always been the heart of Magic Kingdom, and

home to all your favorite Disney stories.
Now this magical place is almost double in

size, and New Fantasyland is bringing those
classic stories to life like never before!
Let's check it out!

When it's all finished, New Fantasyland will
be the biggest expansion in the Magic Kingdom

Park history. On one side is the Enchanted
Forest, full of lush greenery, roaring waterfalls,

and two new castles--all Imagineered to put
you right in the middle of your favorite fairy
tales.

�Due to the fact that guests are seeing
in entertainment in ways they have never seen

it before, in movies and print and on-line.
Walt Disney Imagineering is really stepping

it up, and really bringing that into our attractions
in ways we have never done in the past.

The artistry and attention to detail all around
really do bring your favorite stories...

Hey�there�s Belle! Shhhh! I used to love
story time when I was a little girl. Ooh,
I know this one!

The heroes of our story��that's us��begin
in Maurice's workshop, where a magical mirror��love

those!��becomes our doorway to adventure.
Belle and Lumi�re help us relive the one

about a really cute guy who acted like a jerk
and got really, really hairy, and then the

furniture and dinnerware started talking and
singing and...sorry, spoiler alert! I'll just
have to let you experience it for yourself.
Belle! Hi!

Bonjour�That was a lovely tune you were
singing.
Well�Thanks!
It's Belle!
Hey Belle, I�m pretty famished. Any ideas?

I�m sure they can whip something up for
you in the dining room. Would you like to
Be Our Guest?
Let me think about it...yes! Where do I go?

While the dish is prepared, why don�t you
explore the village. Just go through the forest

and follow the bridge. I�ll make sure you
get a magical welcome!
That's the best offer I've had all day. Thanks!

I see the Castle, now where's that bridge?
Hmm, this guy looks familiar.

Excuse me, sir. Do you know where the Beast
Castle is?
Beast?! Where is the beast?!

Whoa, easy, big guy�I�m just looking for
Be Our Guest Restaurant.

What does the Beast have that I don�t?!
Does he have this chiseled jaw? These bulging

biceps? Stay here with me and I'll show you
my trophy collection inside....

Thanks, but I'm good on trophies for now.
I'm assuming this guy was not the magical

welcome I was promised.
Take care, lover boy.
Now this is a magical welcome! Thanks!

All the stunning details in Beast's castle,
like gargoyles, grand murals and gently falling

snow, help immerse you in this "tale as old
as time" like never before. You can dine in

one of three incredibly styled rooms in the
castle, and even see the enchanted rose. Look,

but don't touch--Beast can get a little cranky
about that flower.

Beast isn't the only one with a new castle,
though. Prince Eric has his own charming little

seaside spot as well, where you can climb
aboard your very own clamshell and experience
Under the Sea - Journey of the Little Mermaid.

On the other side of New Fantasyland is Storybook
Circus, where you can step right up and celebrate

the golden age of big-top entertainment. And
if you really believe, you can take flight

on not one, but TWO Dumbo the Flying Elephant
attractions!

There's even more magic, music and thrills
coming soon, with The Seven Dwarfs Mine Train!

Here in New Fantasyland, where your favorite
stories come to life all around you, it's

easy to believe in magic...no matter how grown
up you are. Thanks for joining me on this
journey, See ya!

comments.text:
There's only one problem: an extreme lack of space. The only thing they 
could probably do is update the dark rides with modern technology and 
rework the scenes again, but the alpine village atmosphere is timeless and 
a perfect theme for Fantasyland. I don't think Disney would replace any of 
the rides because they're classics, except for Pinocchio. I could see them 
adding Frozen elements to the Matterhorn though with the snow monster and 
mountain climbing scenes from the movie.

comments.text:
It does help to keep in mind where those stats are starting from. The Magic 
Kingdom is the most-visited theme park in the world at 17.5M in 2012. IOA 
is the 10th most visited at 8M. Everybody is flipping their wigs about 
Harry Potter and crying about how Disney needs to "keep up" without 
realizing that Harry Potter just slightly raised IOA's status as an 
also-ran. It has considerable distance to go before it even becomes 
competition with Hollywood Studios.

comments.text:
It's the biggest expansion yet it's done on the cheap. We lose a ride for a 
meet and greet. We're waiting on a kiddie coaster to open while Universal 
builds Transformers in 6 months. Tomorrowland 94 was how an expansion 
should be done. New Fantasyland is a joke.
comments.author: Horizons1

comments.text: Why does Gaston have a southern accent? Isn't this story based in France?
comments.author: sizzle563

comments.text:
Do a search for the TEA Report for 2012. Magic Kingdom's attendance rose 
2.4%. That's not much considering they opened a whole new land. Compare 
that to Universal's Islands of Adventure which rose 4% despite Harry Potter 
Land being open for several years now. Of course blowing all the other 
theme parks "worldwide" out of the water is Disney California Adventure 
with it's 22+% increase.
comments.author: Linda Heatherway

comments.text: Attendance is way up.
comments.author: John Alois

comments.text:
@Linda Heatherway. I'd love to see a source. From everything I've seen and 
read attenemce
comments.author: John Alois

comments.text:
New Fantasyland looks nice, but it's not driving in the massive crowds the 
way Cars Land in California is STILL doing. Disney California Adventure's 
attendance rose 22+% last year in just the six months Cars Land was opened. 
Walt Disney World was hoping for the same, but it never happened. And with 
the overwhelming success of "Tangled", its sad that the area of New 
Fantasyland dedicated to that film is just for...going to the bathroom. 
It's fun and interesting, but only if you have to poop.
comments.author: Linda Heatherway

comments.text:
I've been there. Don't waste your money. Disneyland is 100 times better.The 
rides are too spread out at Disney world and unless you plan to stay there 
a whole month you won't be able to see and do everything. I was there for 
10 days and still didn't get to do everything I wanted and. The Magic 
Kingdom is so small. Its mostly filled with a lot of character greetings 
and crap like that. I was really disappointed rides kept breaking down all 
the time. Yeah it was a waste. Disneyland is way better!
